item.title: Erin add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Erin add a quote by G.E. Lessing
item.description: "Think wrongly, if you please, but in all cases think for yourself." -- G.E. Lessing

item.title: Erin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Erin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Never tell the truth to people who are not worthy of it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Erin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Erin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone you may still exist, but you have ceased to live." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Erin add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Man is the only creature who refuses to be what he is." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Erin add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "You know what charm is: a way of getting the answer yes without having asked any clear question." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Erin add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Idleness is fatal only to the mediocre." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Erin add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Man is always prey to his truths. Once he has admitted them, he cannot free himself from them." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Erin add a quote by Anthony Burgess
item.description: "To be left alone is the most precious thing one can ask of the modern world." -- Anthony Burgess

item.title: Erin add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Erin add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Erin add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Erin add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If we find ourselves with a desire that nothing in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that we were made for another world." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Erin add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Love is not affectionate feeling, but a steady wish for the loved person's ultimate good as far as it can be obtained." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Erin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "When I was a child, adults would tell me not to make things up, warning me of what would happen if I did. As far as I can tell so far, it seems to involve lots of foreign travel and not having to get up too early in the morning." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Erin add a quote by Alain Robbe-Grillet
item.description: "To tell the truth, girls are no longer the way they used to be. They play gangsters, nowadays, just like boys. They organize rackets. They plan holdups and practice karate. They will rape defenseless adolescents. They wear pants... Life has become impossible." -- Alain Robbe-Grillet

item.title: Erin add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Love does not consist of gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Erin add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "The most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or touched, they are felt with the heart." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
